profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:44:12 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 scrapbooks, 1942-1958, containing letters from art associations and societies, notifying Casebier that his works won exhibition awards; loan agreements and receipts; clippings; exhibition catalogs; and photographs. Also included are letters, telegrams and greeting cards from friends, museums and art organizations, 1945-1966; typescripts of 2 essays; printed material; photographs of Casebier, his stained glass works and paintings, 1951-1960; printed material and book covers illustrating Casebier's work; and miscellany.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3307-3308 available for use only at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to Cecil Lang Casebier after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, stained glass artist, and educator; San Antonio, Texas.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1982 by Cecil Lang Casebier.
